publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-940 Trish Godman: Use of Mobile Phones on Trains—That the Parliament deplores the willingness with which many mobile phone users on trains divulge intimate details of their domestic and business affairs to their fellow passengers; notes the increase in the frequency of mobile phone use on trains and the constant inconvenience to non-phone using passengers, and calls upon the rail operators to designate phone free zones on all trains.

S1M-940 Trish Godman: Use of Mobile Phones on Trains-That the Parliament deplores the willingness with which many mobile phone users on trains divulge intimate details of their domestic and business affairs to their fellow passengers; notes the increase in the frequency of mobile phone use on trains and the constant inconvenience to non-phone using passengers, and calls upon the rail operators to designate phone free zones on all trains. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-940 Use of Mobile Phones on Trains (lodged on 1 June 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-940 Use of Mobile Phones on Trains (lodged on 1 June 2000) Des McNulty*, Mr John McAllion*

S1M-940 Trish Godman: Use of Mobile Phones on Trains-That the Parliament deplores the willingness with which many mobile phone users on trains divulge intimate details of their domestic and business affairs to their fellow passengers; notes the increase in the frequency of mobile phone use on trains and the constant inconvenience to non-phone using passengers, and calls upon the rail operators to designate phone free zones on all trains. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Des McNulty, Mr John McAllion, Robin Harper*
S1M-940 Use of Mobile Phones on Trains (lodged on 1 June 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Fergus Ewing*
S1M-940 Use of Mobile Phones on Trains (lodged on 1 June 2000) Mr Mike Rumbles*

S1M-940 Trish Godman: Use of Mobile Phones on Trains—That the Parliament deplores the willingness with which many mobile phone users on trains divulge intimate details of their domestic and business affairs to their fellow passengers; notes the increase in the frequency of mobile phone use on trains and the constant inconvenience to non-phone using passengers, and calls upon the rail operators to designate phone free zones on all trains. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Des McNulty, Mr John McAllion, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fergus Ewing, Mr Mike Rumbles, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-940 Use of Mobile Phones on Trains (lodged on 1 June 2000) Richard Lochhead*
S1M-940 Use of Mobile Phones on Trains (lodged on 1 June 2000) Alex Neil*

Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Des McNulty, Mr John McAllion, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fergus Ewing, Mr Mike Rumbles, Maureen Macmillan, Richard Lochhead, Alex Neil
